Class FixedDiceRoller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Utils.Dice.FixedDiceRoller

  • Constructor Details

    • FixedDiceRoller

      public FixedDiceRoller(int i)
      Constructs a FixedDiceRoller instance with a predefined sequence of dice rolls. The initial sequence is determined by the input parameter.
      Parameters:
      i - an integer used to determine the sequence of dice rolls. If 0, the sequence will be [9, 5, 7, 2, 3]. Otherwise, the sequence will be [9, 5, 9, 2, 3].

    • FixedDiceRoller

      public FixedDiceRoller(ArrayList<Integer> sequence)
      Constructs a FixedDiceRoller with a predefined sequence of integer values. The sequence represents the fixed dice rolls that will be returned when rolling the dice.
      Parameters:
      sequence - an ArrayList of integers representing the predefined dice rolls

  • Method Details

    • roll

      public int roll()
      Simulates rolling a die by returning the next predefined value in the sequence. Throws an exception if there are no more values available in the sequence.
      Specified by:
      roll in interface DiceRoller
      Returns:
      the next integer value in the predefined sequence of dice rolls
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if all values in the sequence have already been used

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the state of the dice roller to its initial position. For FixedDiceRoller, it sets the internal index back to the start of the sequence.
      Specified by:
      reset in interface DiceRoller
